intro: Ixora homolleae, commonly known as the Malabar ixora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Ixora homolleae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
